content.body: Ian Hickson: please fix live DOM viewer :). Or open source it somewhere so we can host our own.
content.formatted_body: Ian Hickson: please fix live DOM viewer :). Or open source it somewhere so we can host our own.

content.body: In the meantime, I like https://livedom.bentkowski.info/ a lot. It's got a "share URL" feature but that just throws the whole input into a URL parameter which might be a bit long and unwieldy
keithamus: I'm not sure I understand https://github.com/whatwg/fullscreen/issues/124#issuecomment-1738125683, but it also seems like something that is better raised with the CSS WG?
content.formatted_body: keithamus: I'm not sure I understand https://github.com/whatwg/fullscreen/issues/124#issuecomment-1738125683, but it also seems like something that is better raised with the CSS WG?

content.body: Sure, I can raise it there. I was mostly +1ing and adding what I thought would be useful context.
content.formatted_body: Sure, I can raise it there. I was mostly +1ing and adding what I thought would be useful context.

content.body: johannhof: Noam Rosenthal: should Set-Cookie be honored on 101 (current answer is yes), 103 (current answer is no), and other 1xx responses (current answer is no)? I'll open an issue against Fetch for this because I don't think we have fully considered it.
content.formatted_body: johannhof: Noam Rosenthal: should Set-Cookie be honored on 101 (current answer is yes), 103 (current answer is no), and other 1xx responses (current answer is no)? I'll open an issue against Fetch for this because I don't think we have fully considered it.
